snippet: The data frustrated expectations for an increase after sharp gains in the Conference Board’s index of consumer attitudes in November and December.
abstract: Conference Board report shows that Americans are losing confidence about the job market and their income prospects as an index of consumer attitudes fell to 61.1 in January from 64.8 the month before; Institute for Supply Management-Chicago says its Chicago Business Barometer index also fell to 60.2 in January from 62.2 in December.
lead_paragraph: The data frustrated expectations for an increase after sharp gains in the Conference Board’s index of consumer attitudes in November and December.

headline.main: In Reversal, Consumer Confidence Turns Down
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Consumer Confidence Turns Down
